blocks.data: <w:br/>This whitepaper document contains results of performance measurements for Magento Commerce 2.2.4 running on Magento Cloud infrastructure for cases of Small, Medium, Large and Extra-large profiles, validating that platform meets requirements of high-loaded e-commerce site. Additionally, whitepaper has client-side measurements for main pages. It will help e-commerce managers and technical staff to better understand the performance characteristics of the application and select appropriate plan for Magento Commerce store.

rows.text: website/store/store view: 1<w:br/>individual simples: 800<w:br/>configurable products: 40<w:br/>(with 15 simples for each configurable ~ 600 simples)<w:br/>categories: 30
website/store/store view: 3<w:br/>individual simples: 24K<w:br/>configurable products: 640<w:br/>(with 11 simples for each configurable ~ 7K simples)<w:br/>categories: 300
website/store/store view: 5<w:br/>individual simples: 300K<w:br/>configurable products: 8K<w:br/>(with 11 simples for each configurable ~ 88K simples)<w:br/>categories: 3k
website/store/store view: 5<w:br/>individual simples: 600K<w:br/>configurable products: 16K<w:br/>(with 11 simples for each configurable ~ 176K simples)<w:br/>categories: 6k

blocks.data: <w:br/>1) Cache hit/miss rateÂ 60 / 40%<w:br/>2) Each user performs 2-3 actions (clicks) per minute [average industry rate is 1 click per 1-2 minutes]<w:br/>3) Load average was chosen equals 1 user/core.

data.title: CPU
data.query: SELECT SUM("system:second")/(30000/1000) as "system", SUM("user:second")/(30000/1000) as "user", SUM("nice:second")/(30000/1000) as "nice", SUM("idle:second")/(30000/1000) as "idle", SUM("iowait:second")/(30000/1000) as "iowait", SUM("irq:second")/(30000/1000) as "irq", SUM("softirq:second")/(30000/1000) as "softirq", SUM("steal:second")/(30000/1000) as "steal", SUM("guest:second")/(30000/1000) as "guest" FROM "cpu" WHERE "cluster" = '%cluster_id%' AND "host" = 'i-%sub_host_name%.platform.sh' AND time >= %start_time%ms and time <= %end_time%ms GROUP BY time(30s) fill(none)
